str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To travel, journey, go, die.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From ana and pipto; to fall back, i.e. Lie down, lean back.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go up to, come up to, go up further. From pros and anabaino; to ascend farther, i.e. Be promoted (more honorable) seat).
Comparative degree of ano; upper, i.e. to a more conspicuous place, in a former part of the book.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To recline at table with. From sun and anakeimai; to recline in company with.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
